@graph.name: Milk Tea: What It is, How to Make It, and Types Including Bubble Tea - Oh, How Civilized
@graph.description: See what milk tea is and how simple it is to make it decadent with brown sugar. Plus, check out the different types of milk tea, including boba tea!

itemListElement.name: Milk Tea: What It is, How to Make It, and Types Including Bubble Tea

@graph.headline: Milk Tea: What It is, How to Make It, and Types Including Bubble Tea

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes! See the step-by-step iced milk tea recipe.

@graph.name: Can I add honey instead of brown sugar?

acceptedAnswer.text: Add any kind of sweetener that you like. I just prefer brown sugar. You can also try date syrup, maple syrup, or even a flavored simple syrup like lavender syrup.

@graph.name: How many tea bags should I use if I don't have loose tea?

acceptedAnswer.text: Use 1 tea sachet or 1 tea bag.

@graph.name: What's the difference between bubble tea and milk tea?

acceptedAnswer.text: Bubble tea is milk tea with boba or tapioca balls in the drink.

@graph.name: Decadent Milk Tea with Brown Sugar
@graph.description: A creamy and sweet milk tea recipe.

video.name: How to Make Milk Tea
video.description: Decadent milk tea with brown sugar.

recipeIngredient: 1 cup water (+ more to warm teapot)

recipeInstructions.text: Boil water.Boil water on the stovetop or use an electric kettle with a temperature setting, setting the water temperature to 208°F. Boil a little more water than needed so that it can be used to warm up the teapot. Filtered water is best since the better the water tastes, the better your tea will taste.
recipeInstructions.name: Boil water.Boil water on the stovetop or use an electric kettle with a temperature setting, setting the water temperature to 208°F. Boil a little more water than needed so that it can be used to warm up the teapot. Filtered water is best since the better the water tastes, the better your tea will taste.

recipeInstructions.text: Warm up teapot.Pour some hot water into a teapot and swirl the water around to warm up the teapot. Discard the water. Now, your teapot is nice and warm to steep tea in.
recipeInstructions.name: Warm up teapot.Pour some hot water into a teapot and swirl the water around to warm up the teapot. Discard the water. Now, your teapot is nice and warm to steep tea in.

recipeInstructions.text: Combine tea and hot water in a teapot. Cover and steep for 5 minutes.Make sure the tea is covered in water, and not just sitting on top, to get a full steep.
recipeInstructions.name: Combine tea and hot water in a teapot. Cover and steep for 5 minutes.Make sure the tea is covered in water, and not just sitting on top, to get a full steep.

recipeInstructions.text: Strain tea leaves and pour hot tea into a teacup.
recipeInstructions.name: Strain tea leaves and pour hot tea into a teacup.

recipeInstructions.text: Stir in brown sugar and add in half & half.Add the sugar right after you pour in your tea so that it can dissolve quickly in the hot tea. The half & half will swirl around in the dark tea. I'm using a generous amount of half & half (¼ cup) but feel free to add as little or as much as you like. Stir before drinking.
recipeInstructions.name: Stir in brown sugar and add in half & half.Add the sugar right after you pour in your tea so that it can dissolve quickly in the hot tea. The half & half will swirl around in the dark tea. I'm using a generous amount of half & half (¼ cup) but feel free to add as little or as much as you like. Stir before drinking.
